page.title: 13Housing
page.content: There are two small private housing estates and one council estate which contains some sheltered housing.There are 4 1890's/1900 terraces.Preesall and Pilling contain older properties but with modern post-war in-filling especially on Pilling Lane.Many of the farm houses are old and on ancient sites and will repay a visit.We have included two houses: 1Parrox Hall (03600478) was built by Richrd Fleetwood in 1656.It is open to the public on Gardeners' Sunday.It is owned by the Elletsons,Squires of Preesall since the time of King John. 2Cocker's Dyke (03760496) dates from 1629.Legend has it that the roof is older than the walls.Cobblestone walls are typical of the Fylde.The house contains a buttery chamber and main living area and is 2 feet narrower at upper bay than at the service room end
